document.title: Kansas Model Curricular Standard for Music

CA269930DFE50131C66468A86D17958E.description: demonstrates appropriate behavior while attending live musical events.

CA2645F0DFE50131C66368A86D17958E.description: The student demonstrates audience behavior appropriate for the context and style of music performed.

CA25F7B0DFE50131C66268A86D17958E.description: classifies the roles of musicians in various music settings and cultures.

CA25ADF0DFE50131C66168A86D17958E.description: The student identifies and describes roles of musicians in various music settings and cultures.

CA255FF0DFE50131C66068A86D17958E.description: identifies and describes characteristics of music used in her/his daily life.

CA251AB0DFE50131C65F68A86D17958E.description: The student identifies various uses of music in her/his daily experiences and describes characteristics that make certain music suitable for each use.

CA24D1A0DFE50131C65E68A86D17958E.description: explains how elements of music are used in various cultures.

CA247980DFE50131C65D68A86D17958E.description: The student describes in simple terms how elements of music are used in music examples from various cultures of the world.

CA241DD0DFE50131C65C68A86D17958E.description: identifies by genre or style, aural examples of music from various cultures.

CA23B100DFE50131C65B68A86D17958E.description: identifies by genre or style, aural examples of music from various historical periods.

CA2368F0DFE50131C65A68A86D17958E.description: The student identifies by genre or style aural examples of music from various historical periods and cultures.

CA22C4C0DFE50131C65868A86D17958E.description: Understanding music in relation to history and culture

CA227C50DFE50131C65768A86D17958E.description: identifies the interrelationships of the conceptual elements of music and the conceptual elements of several disciplines in the school.

CA222CA0DFE50131C65668A86D17958E.description: The student identifies ways in which the principles and subject matter of other disciplines taught in the school are interrelated with those of music.

CA21E8B0DFE50131C65568A86D17958E.description: defines and explains common terms among several art forms (e.g., balance, texture, color, line).

CA21A370DFE50131C65468A86D17958E.description: The student identifies similarities and differences in the meanings of common terms used in the various arts.

CA20FEB0DFE50131C65268A86D17958E.description: Understanding relationships between music, the other arts, and disciplines outside the arts

CA20AD60DFE50131C65168A86D17958E.description: explains, using appropriate music terminology, their personal preferences for specific musical works and styles.

CA205DE0DFE50131C65068A86D17958E.description: The student explains, using appropriate music terminology, her/his personal preferences for specific musical works and styles.

CA201AB0DFE50131C64F68A86D17958E.description: devises criteria to evaluate a performance or composition.

CA1FD670DFE50131C64E68A86D17958E.description: The student devises criteria for evaluating performances and compositions.

CA1EFBC0DFE50131C64B68A86D17958E.description: responds to selected music characteristics or to specific music events through movement.

CA1EB090DFE50131C64A68A86D17958E.description: The student responds through purposeful movement to selected prominent music characteristics or to specific music events while listening to music.

CA1E54B0DFE50131C64968A86D17958E.description: identifies the sounds of a variety of instruments and voices.

CA1DEB90DFE50131C64868A86D17958E.description: The student identifies the sounds of a variety of instruments, including many orchestra and band instruments from various cultures, as well as children's voices and male and female adult voices.

CA1D9680DFE50131C64768A86D17958E.description: uses appropriate vocabulary when explaining music literature, notation, instruments, voices, and performances.

CA1D4F30DFE50131C64668A86D17958E.description: The student uses appropriate terminology in explaining music, music notation, music instruments, voices, and music performances.

CA1D0A90DFE50131C64568A86D17958E.description: describes the use of music elements in aural examples from diverse cultures.

CA1CC3C0DFE50131C64468A86D17958E.description: The student demonstrates perceptual skills by moving, answering questions about, and describing aural examples of music of various styles representing diverse cultures.

CA1C7E40DFE50131C64368A86D17958E.description: identifies simple music forms when presented aurally (ABA, verse/refrain, etc.).

CA1C34B0DFE50131C64268A86D17958E.description: The student identifies simple music forms when presented aurally.

CA1B84C0DFE50131C64068A86D17958E.description: Listening to, analyzing, and describing music

CA1B3390DFE50131C63F68A86D17958E.description: notates using standard symbols, simple dictated patterns for meter, rhythm, pitch, and dynamics.

CA1AF040DFE50131C63E68A86D17958E.description: The student uses standard symbols to notate meter, rhythm, pitch, and dynamics in simple patterns presented by the teacher.

CA1AAC00DFE50131C63D68A86D17958E.description: interprets traditional terms and symbols for dynamics, tempo, and articulation in performance.

CA1A5A30DFE50131C63C68A86D17958E.description: The student identifies symbols and traditional terms referring to dynamics, tempo, and articulation and interprets them correctly when performing.

CA1A0360DFE50131C63B68A86D17958E.description: reads and notates simple pitch notation using traditional notation.

CA19C030DFE50131C63A68A86D17958E.description: The student uses a system (that is, syllable, number, or letters) to read simple pitch notation in the treble clef in major keys.

CA197BE0DFE50131C63968A86D17958E.description: reads and notates whole, half, dotted half, quarter, and eighth notes and corresponding rests in 2/4, 3/4, and 4/4 meter.

CA193550DFE50131C63868A86D17958E.description: The student reads whole, half, dotted half, quarter, and eighth notes and rests in 2/4, 3/4, and 4/4 meter signatures.

CA184330DFE50131C63568A86D17958E.description: composes short pieces using a variety of sound sources.

CA180290DFE50131C63468A86D17958E.description: The student uses a variety of sound sources when composing.

CA17BFE0DFE50131C63368A86D17958E.description: arranges and creates short songs and/or instrumental pieces.

CA177D50DFE50131C63268A86D17958E.description: The student creates and arranges short songs and instrumental pieces within specified guidelines.

CA173A10DFE50131C63168A86D17958E.description: uses traditional and non-traditional instruments and materials to create a simple rhythmic accompaniment to a poem or story.

CA16F330DFE50131C63068A86D17958E.description: The student creates and arranges music to accompany readings or dramatizations.

CA166480DFE50131C62E68A86D17958E.description: Composing and arranging music within specified guidelines

CA162280DFE50131C62D68A86D17958E.description: improvises an original short song or instrumental piece with a variety of sound sources within specified guidelines.

CA15DEE0DFE50131C62C68A86D17958E.description: The student improvises short songs and instrumental pieces, using a variety of sound sources, including traditional sounds, nontraditional sounds available in the classroom, body sounds, and sounds produced by electronic means.

CA159A50DFE50131C62B68A86D17958E.description: improvises an original melodic embellishment on a given melody.

CA155100DFE50131C62A68A86D17958E.description: improvises an original rhythmic variation (note value or meter) on a familiar melody.

CA14FBE0DFE50131C62968A86D17958E.description: The student improvises simple rhythmic variations and simple melodic embellishments on familiar melodies.

CA14B7D0DFE50131C62868A86D17958E.description: improvises simple rhythmic and melodic ostinato accompaniments.

CA146C20DFE50131C62768A86D17958E.description: The student improvises simple rhythmic and melodic ostinati accompaniments.

CA141B80DFE50131C62668A86D17958E.description: improvises "answers" in the same style to given rhythmic and melodic "questions."

CA13C2C0DFE50131C62568A86D17958E.description: The student improvises "answers" in the same style to given rhythmic and melodic phrases.

CA12BBA0DFE50131C62268A86D17958E.description: performs her/his part while other students perform contrasting parts.

CA126B50DFE50131C62168A86D17958E.description: The student performs independent instrumental parts while other students sing or play contrasting parts.

CA122480DFE50131C62068A86D17958E.description: responds to the conductor's cues while performing in groups.

CA11DF50DFE50131C61F68A86D17958E.description: demonstrates appropriate timbre and dynamics while playing in an ensemble setting.

CA119530DFE50131C61E68A86D17958E.description: The student performs in groups, while blending instrumental timbres, matching dynamic levels, and responding to the cues of a conductor.

CA10C3C0DFE50131C61B68A86D17958E.description: The student echoes short rhythmic and melodic patterns.

CA1076E0DFE50131C61A68A86D17958E.description: expressively performs music selected from various periods and cultures.

CA102C10DFE50131C61968A86D17958E.description: The student performs expressively a varied repertoire of music representing diverse genres and styles.

CA0FDB90DFE50131C61868A86D17958E.description: performs chordal patterns accurately and independently as an accompaniment on classroom instruments.

CA0F8A90DFE50131C61768A86D17958E.description: performs melodic patterns accurately and independently on classroom instruments.

CA0F3E90DFE50131C61668A86D17958E.description: performs rhythmic patterns accurately and independently on classroom instruments.

CA0EEFF0DFE50131C61568A86D17958E.description: The student performs easy rhythmic, melodic, and chordal patterns accurately and independently on rhythmic, melodic, and harmonic classroom instruments.

CA0E9BC0DFE50131C61468A86D17958E.description: performs a short song using appropriate timbre.

CA0E51D0DFE50131C61368A86D17958E.description: performs a short song using effective expression.

CA0E0D20DFE50131C61268A86D17958E.description: performs accurate rhythms in simple meters on classroom instruments.

CA0DB1C0DFE50131C61168A86D17958E.description: performs a short song with accurate pitch.

CA0D5AA0DFE50131C61068A86D17958E.description: The student performs on pitch, and in rhythm, with appropriate dynamics and timbre, and maintains a steady tempo [beat].

CA0CA150DFE50131C60E68A86D17958E.description: Performing on instruments, alone and with others, a varied repertoire of music

CA0C5CE0DFE50131C60D68A86D17958E.description: responds expressively to conductor's cues while singing in ensembles.

CA0C1670DFE50131C60C68A86D17958E.description: demonstrates appropriate timbre and dynamics while singing in an ensemble setting.

CA0BBAA0DFE50131C60B68A86D17958E.description: The student sings in groups, blending vocal timbres, matching dynamic levels, and responding to the cues of a conductor.

CA0B7270DFE50131C60A68A86D17958E.description: independently sings simple songs in harmony.

CA0B2060DFE50131C60968A86D17958E.description: The student sings ostinati, partner songs, and rounds.

CA0AD1A0DFE50131C60868A86D17958E.description: sings from memory selected songs characteristic of music from various periods, genres, and cultures.

CA0A8310DFE50131C60768A86D17958E.description: The student sings from memory a varied repertoire of songs representing genres and styles from diverse cultures.

CA0A3360DFE50131C60668A86D17958E.description: sings age appropriate songs using accurate dynamics and phrasing to communicate an interpretation of a given song.

CA09E0D0DFE50131C60568A86D17958E.description: The student sings expressively, with appropriate dynamics, phrasing, and interpretation.

CA099C10DFE50131C60468A86D17958E.description: demonstrates, with a steady tempo (steady beat), accurate duration of each pitch in simple meters.

CA095690DFE50131C60368A86D17958E.description: independently uses a developmentally appropriate voice to sing diatonic songs of at least an octave while maintaining accurate pitch, correct posture, and precise articulation (Diction).

CA091080DFE50131C60268A86D17958E.description: The student sings independently, on pitch, and in rhythm, with appropriate timbre, diction, and posture, and maintains a steady tempo [beat].

CA0875A0DFE50131C60068A86D17958E.description: Singing, alone and with others, a varied repertoire of music
